intro: Oreocharis lungshengensis, commonly known as the Lungsheng orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and coloration. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, where it thrives on rocky substrates. Its flowers are small, often with a striking contrast between the white petals and deep purple sepals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreocharis lungshengensis is considered a vulnerable species.
